Package edu.ucsd.sbrg.util

Class SBMLUtils

java.lang.Object
edu.ucsd.sbrg.util.SBMLUtils
public class SBMLUtils extends Object
A collection of helpful functions for dealing with SBML data structures.

  • Method Details

    • updateGeneProductReference

      public static void updateGeneProductReference(org.sbml.jsbml.ext.fbc.GeneProduct gp)
      Updates the reference of a gene product in the geneProductReferences map using the gene product's ID. If the gene product ID starts with "G_", it strips this prefix before updating. If the map is initially empty, it initializes the map with the current model's reactions.
      Parameters:
      gp - The GeneProduct whose reference needs to be updated.

    • clearGPRMap

      public static void clearGPRMap()
      Clears the geneProductReferences map, removing all entries.

    • updateReactionRef

      public static void updateReactionRef(String oldId, String newId, org.sbml.jsbml.ext.fbc.FBCModelPlugin fbcModelPlug)
      Updates the reaction reference ID from an old ID to a new ID within the FluxObjectives of a given FBCModelPlugin. This method iterates through all objectives and their associated flux objectives in the model plugin, replacing the old reaction ID with the new one wherever found.
      Parameters:
      oldId - The old reaction ID to be replaced.
      newId - The new reaction ID to replace the old one.
      fbcModelPlug - The FBCModelPlugin containing the objectives and flux objectives to be updated.

    • createSubsystemLink

      public static void createSubsystemLink(org.sbml.jsbml.Reaction r, org.sbml.jsbml.ext.groups.Member member)
      Establishes a link between a reaction and a subsystem member by setting the member's reference to the reaction. Additionally, it ensures that the reaction maintains a set of all members linked to it. If the set does not exist, it is created and the member is added to it.
      Parameters:
      r - The reaction object to which the member should be linked.
      member - The subsystem member that should be linked to the reaction.
